chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Samantha K Gregory was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 28 days if revoked.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to any other probation sentence.

miscConds.notes: Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.

Follow recommendations of agent.
Submit a DNA sample.
PAY DIRECT TO CLERK OF COURTS, ANY BOND POSTED MAY BE APPLIED

timeConds.notes: To be held in abeyance for use by agent.

records.addlTxt:
4:08 PM Defendant Samantha K Gregory in court, in custody from the DCJ.  Attorney Jonathan Bradley Lundeen appeared by video for Samantha K Gregory.  Prosecuting attorney Lucas D Arras in court for the State of Wisconsin. A. Standaert - Clerk 

20CF374, 21CM13, 21CM215, 22CF167

Deft - waives personal appearance of counsel
Atty Lundeen - deft will enter plea to Ct 2 in 20CF374, Ct 1 in 21CM215, Ct 1 in 21CM13, and Ct 1 in 22CF167 - joint recommendation for 3 years probation, AODA, credit for 31 days if revoked - asks for conditional jail to be held in abeyance
State - believes there are 32 days jail credit and agrees conditional jail may be held in abeyance - will need a waiver of prelim in 22CF167 - restitution is TBD
Court  - speaks to deft's right to preliminary hearing
Deft - waives right to preliminary hearing in 22CF167
Court - accepts waiver and finds it given freely and knowingly - finds probable cause and binds deft over

Court - reads charges and max penalties
Deft - waives rights & JT, enters a guilty plea to: Ct 2 in 20CF374, Ct 1 in 21CM215, Ct 1 in 21CM13, and Ct 1 in 22CF167

Parties stip that facts support the plea.

Court - finds waiver of rights & plea voluntary, free & knowing & approves stip by parties to facts
Accepts guilty pleas and finds defendant guilty

State - makes statement, victim's right have been complied with, asks Court to accept joint agreement
Atty Lundeen - makes statement, also asks Court to accept joint recommendation
Deft - makes statement to the Court

Court orders:
Ct 2 in 20CF374 (MDP 20-1618) - sentence withheld, 2 years probation - all to run concurrent
  - Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations
  - Follow recommendations of agent
  - Court costs $443
  - Credit for 32 days
  - Restitution TBD
  - Submit a DNA sample

Ct 1 in 21CM215 (MPD 21-1441) - sentence withheld, 2 years probation - all to run concurrent
  - Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations
  - Follow recommendations of agent
  - Court costs $463 + $10 drug abuse surcharge
  - Credit for 29 days
  - Restitution TBD
  - Submit a DNA sample

Ct 1 in 21CM13 (MDP 21-0112) - sentence withheld, 2 years probation - all to run concurrent
  - Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations
  - Follow recommendations of agent
  - Court costs $463 + $10 drug abuse surcharge
  - Credit for 29 days
  - Restitution TBD
  - Submit a DNA sample

Ct 1 in 22CF167 (D22-0766) - sentence withheld, 3 years probation - all to run concurrent
  - Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations
  - Follow recommendations of agent
  - 60 days conditional jail to be held in abeyance for use by agent
  - Court costs $538 + $10 drug abuse surcharge
  - Submit a DNA sample
  - Restitution TBD
  - Credit for 28 days

**Credit for 32 days if revoked

Dismissed and read-in: Count 1 in 20CF374, Counts 2 & 3 in 21CM13, Counts 2 & 3 in 21CM215, and Count 2 in 22CF167
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 26, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

11:35 AM Defendant Samantha K Gregory appeared by video, in custody from the Dunn County Jail.  Attorney Jonathan Bradley Lundeen appeared by video for Samantha K Gregory.  Prosecuting attorney Megan E. Kelly in court for the State of Wisconsin. A. Standaert - Clerk 

20CF374, 21CM13, 21CM215, 22CF167

Atty Lundeen - filed motion to modify bond, but cases are resolved
State - deft will be entering plea to 1 felony and 3 misd.
Atty Lundeen - makes argument, asks to modification bond in 20CF374 and 21CM13
State - objects
Court - not modifying bonds today, schedules plea/sent for Monday
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Plea hearing on October 11, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Plea hearing on December 1, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Status conference on September 22, 2022 at 11:35 am.
Modifies bond from $250 cash to $200 cash.

10:15 AM Defendant Samantha K Gregory in court in custody from DCJ.  Attorney Jonathan Bradley Lundeen in court for Samantha K Gregory.  Prosecuting attorney Megan E. Kelly in court for the State of Wisconsin. B. Bahr - Clerk 
(21CM215, 22CF167 BR 3 cases) (20CF374, 21CM13 BR 1 cases)

20CF374, 21CM13 BR 1 cases
Atty Lundeen - argues for high signature bond. DE is now eligible for treatment court.  Matters are very close to resolution.
State - 20CF374 did not have time to notify victim of request to modify bond. Objects to bond modification. 
Court - will not consider this today so victim rights can be complied with. Bond remains. Sets bond hearing on 9/22/22 at 11:35 AM. 21CM215, 22CF167 are set as status hearings in Branch 1.


21CM215, 22CF167 - bond
Atty Lundeen - argues. Speaks of missed appearances. DE did not have valid license
Court - modifies bond in both cases from $250 cash to $200 cash. All other conditions remain.
Atty Lundeen - asks for another date. 
Court - sets plea date
Plea hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 11:35 am.
